DOC.brief_summary: P16 negative cancers continue to have a dismal prognosis despite advances in the treatment of head and neck cancer. Acceleration, dose-escalation, hyperfractionation, chemotherapy and nimorazole has been shown to improve local control. The purpose of the study i to investigate the level of co-morbidity and performance status (PS) that allows the combination of all of the above means of treatment intensification
DOC.brief_title: DAHANCA 28A: Phase I/II Study on Accelerated, Hyperfractionated Radiotherapy With Concomitant Cisplatin and Nimorazole
DOC.criteria: Squamous Cell Carcinoma head and neck cancer of the pharynx, larynx and oral cavity P16 negative T14 N13 M0 Organ function and performance status allowing radical chemoradiotherapy
